episodeTitle: Swear on Your Crewmate's Dream! Battle at Molehill 4th Avenue
episodeTitleJapanese: 仲間の夢に誓う！決闘モグラ塚4番街
episodeTitleRomanized: Nakama no Yume ni Chikau! Kettō Mogura Tsuka Yonban-gai
description: Usopp and Chopper continue their desperate battle against Mr. 4 and Miss Merry Christmas in the underground tunnels of Alubarna. When taunted that Luffy has been killed by Crocodile, Usopp finds the resolve to fight for his captain's dream.

events.title: Underground Battle Continues
events.description: Usopp and Chopper continue their struggle against Mr. 4 and Miss Merry Christmas in the underground tunnel system beneath Alubarna. The enemies maintain their advantage with Miss Merry Christmas's underground mobility and Mr. 4's explosive baseballs.
events.significance: Shows the ongoing difficulty of the battle and sets up the desperate situation that forces Usopp and Chopper to find creative solutions.

events.title: Usopp's Fake 5-Ton Hammer
events.description: Usopp emerges from Miss Merry Christmas's mole holes and strikes Mr. 4 over the head with what appears to be a massive 5-ton hammer. The attack seems to connect successfully.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's tactical creativity and willingness to use deception in battle. This bluffing tactic is characteristic of Usopp's fighting style throughout the series.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp attacks Mr. 4 from above after emerging from a tunnel

events.title: The Hammer is Revealed as Fake
events.description: Mr. 4 quickly recovers from the hammer strike, revealing that the 5-ton hammer is actually made of paper mache and weighs only 4.4 pounds. The ruse is exposed and Usopp's bluff fails.
events.significance: Shows both Usopp's cleverness in attempting deception and the limitation of such tactics against physically superior opponents. The reveal creates both comedy and tension.

quotes.text: What kind of 5-ton hammer only weighs 4.4 pounds?!
quotes.speaker: Miss Merry Christmas
quotes.context: Mocking Usopp after discovering his fake hammer

events.title: Whack-a-Mole Battle
events.description: Usopp begins playing whack-a-mole with Miss Merry Christmas, trying to strike her as she pops in and out of the various tunnel entrances. The battle becomes a chaotic game of timing and reflexes.
events.significance: Demonstrates the unique nature of fighting a Mogu Mogu no Mi user who can move freely underground. This sequence highlights both the challenge and absurdity of their situation.

events.title: Chopper's Transformations in Battle
events.description: Chopper demonstrates his versatility by cycling through multiple transformation forms during the battle: Walk Point for speed and evasion, Brain Point for analysis, Horn Point for defense, and his buff Heavy Point form for strength.
events.significance: Showcases Chopper's tactical versatility as a fighter and his ability to adapt to different combat situations. Establishes him as one of the most adaptable Straw Hats in terms of combat options.

events.title: Miss Merry Christmas Claims Luffy is Dead
events.description: Miss Merry Christmas taunts Usopp by telling him that Luffy has been killed by Crocodile. This causes Usopp to initially panic and consider fleeing, showing his fear and doubt.
events.significance: This moment tests Usopp's loyalty and courage. The taunt about Luffy's death becomes the catalyst for Usopp's character development in this arc, forcing him to confront what his captain's dream means to him.

quotes.text: Your captain Straw Hat Luffy has already been defeated by Sir Crocodile!
quotes.speaker: Miss Merry Christmas

events.title: Usopp's Resolve - Swearing on Luffy's Dream
events.description: Despite hearing that Luffy may be dead, Usopp stops running and declares that he will fight to protect Luffy's dream of becoming King of the Pirates. He swears on his crewmate's dream that he won't give up.
events.significance: This is a pivotal character moment for Usopp, showing his growth from a cowardly character to someone willing to risk his life for his captain's dreams. It establishes the depth of his loyalty to Luffy and foreshadows his future moments of bravery.

quotes.text: Even if Luffy is dead, I have to protect his dream! I swear on my crewmate's dream!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp's declaration of resolve during the battle

events.title: Chopper Discovers Tunnel Connection
events.description: Using his Brain Point form, Chopper analyzes the underground tunnel system and discovers that all the mole holes are interconnected. This revelation provides a potential weakness in their enemies' strategy.
events.significance: Demonstrates Chopper's intelligence and analytical abilities in his Brain Point form. This discovery becomes crucial to defeating Mr. 4 and Miss Merry Christmas.

quotes.text: I've figured it out! All the tunnels are connected!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper's realization about the tunnel system structure

events.title: Strategic Plan Using Lassoo
events.description: Chopper realizes they can use Mr. 4's weapon Lassoo against their enemies by directing the explosive baseball shots into the interconnected tunnel system, which would trap and damage both opponents underground.
events.significance: Shows the tactical teamwork between Usopp and Chopper as they turn their enemies' strengths into weaknesses. This strategy sets up the conclusion of their battle.

events.title: Rebellion Advance Continues
events.description: Brief scenes show Koza leading the rebel army's continued advance toward Alubarna palace while Vivi desperately tries to find a way to stop the fighting.
events.significance: Maintains the tension of the larger Arabasta conflict while the individual battles rage. Shows the time pressure on the Straw Hats to resolve their fights and help Vivi stop the war.

quotes.text: Even if Luffy is dead, I have to protect his dream! I swear on my crewmate's dream!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp's pivotal moment of resolve when told Luffy was defeated by Crocodile

quotes.text: Your captain Straw Hat Luffy has already been defeated by Sir Crocodile!
quotes.speaker: Miss Merry Christmas

quotes.text: I've figured it out! All the tunnels are connected!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Discovering the weakness in the tunnel system

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Attacking Mr. 4 with his fake hammer

themes.description: The episode deeply explores Usopp's loyalty to Luffy and his willingness to fight for his captain's dream even when faced with the possibility of Luffy's death.
themes.symbolism: Usopp's decision to stand and fight represents his commitment to the crew's bonds over his own safety.

themes.description: Usopp's character arc in this episode shows that true courage isn't the absence of fear, but taking action despite being terrified.
themes.symbolism: The underground tunnels represent Usopp's internal struggle - he can run and hide, or emerge to face his fears.

themes.description: Both Usopp and Chopper demonstrate that tactical thinking and adaptability can overcome physically superior opponents.
themes.symbolism: The fake hammer and the tunnel discovery show that brains can triumph over brawn.

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp transforms from wanting to flee to standing his ground when he realizes the importance of protecting Luffy's dream. This episode marks significant growth in his character from coward to brave warrior.
keyActions: Uses fake 5-ton hammer to deceive Mr. 4
Plays whack-a-mole with Miss Merry Christmas
Declares his resolve to fight for Luffy's dream
quotes: Even if Luffy is dead, I have to protect his dream! I swear on my crewmate's dream!

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper demonstrates his value as both a fighter and strategist, using his various transformations and intelligence to analyze the battlefield and find weaknesses in their enemies' tactics.
keyActions: Uses multiple Zoan transformations in combat
Analyzes the tunnel system with Brain Point
Devises strategy to use Lassoo against enemies
quotes: I've figured it out! All the tunnels are connected!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the battle sequences and adds more detailed animation of Chopper's various transformations compared to the manga.
The anime adds additional dialogue between Usopp and Chopper discussing their strategy, which is more abbreviated in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts portions of manga chapters 184, 185, and 186 from Volume 20.
The 'swearing on a crewmate's dream' theme established in this episode becomes a recurring motif for Usopp's character development throughout the series.
This episode aired as part of the second opening theme 'Believe' by Folder5's final episode run, as the opening changed to 'Hikari E' starting with episode 116.
Chopper's Brain Point analysis of the tunnel system showcases his intelligence, which is often overshadowed by his cute appearance.
